column12: ## OMH Blood Pressure DataPoint to FHIR Observation Detailed Mapping
The following Table provides the detailed mapping for the OMH Blood Pressure DataPoint to the OMH to FHIR Observation Profile TODO: add link to map and profile:

column5: This schema represents a person's blood pressure as a combination of systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

column11: Mappping depends on type- see below

column5: This schema describes an interval of time. In the absence of a precise start and/or end time, the time interval can be described as a date + a part of the day (morning, afternoon, evening, night). No commitments are made as to whether the start or end time point itself is included in the interval (i.e., whether the defined interval includes the boundary point(s) or not).

The location on the body where the blood pressure measuring device is placed for measurement. A location on the body. This is an incomplete value set. Values from the Anatomical or acquired body structure hierarchy of  SNOMED can be added as needed. The SNOMED code represents Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure)

column11: Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)
column12: |8.2|body.measurement_location|Observation.bodySIte.coding[0].code|Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)|

column11: Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept System' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)
column12: |8.3|body.measurement_location|Observation.bodySIte.coding[0].system|Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept System' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)|

column11: Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept display' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)
column12: |8.4|body.measurement_location|Observation.bodySIte.coding[0].display|Map body.measurement_location to column 'FHIR Concept display' using  the [OMH_FHIR_Concept_Mapping_Table](#)|

column5: The descriptive statistic of a set of measurements. A measurement value can be the result of combining various measurements and calculating descriptive statistics like average, maximum, minimum, etc. Additional descriptive statistics will be added as the need arises. A measurement value without a descriptive statistic is interpreted as being the result of an individual measurement.
column11: Map  descriptive statistic to the OMH to FHIR additional Observation codings ( code system http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/omh_fhir_observation_codes).
column12: |10|body.descriptive_statistic|Observation.code.coding[1]|Map  descriptive statistic to the OMH to FHIR additional Observation codings ( code system http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/omh_fhir_observation_codes).|

column11: concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'blood-pressure'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= blood-pressure-maximum
column12: |10.1|body.descriptive_statistic|Observation.code.coding[1].code|concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'blood-pressure'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= blood-pressure-maximum|

column11: concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'blood-pressure'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= blood-pressure-maximum
column12: |10.3|body.descriptive_statistic|Observation.code.coding[1].display|concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'blood-pressure'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= blood-pressure-maximum|

column5: The temporal relationship of a clinical measure or assessment to physical activity.

column5: The posture of the subject (for example, during a clinical measurement). This value set is not exhaustive.   The SNOMED code represents Position of body and posture (observable entity)"
